threepio.engine
Class CommonCLI

java.lang.Object
  threepio.engine.CommonCLI
Direct Known Subclasses:
MotrCLI, TRminatorCLI
public abstract class CommonCLI
extends java.lang.Object

CommonCLI holds some commonly useful CLI methods.

Author:
jhoule

Method Detail

optionsWithArgs

public abstract java.lang.String[] optionsWithArgs()
returns an array of Strings that represent the options (command-line arguments) that have arguments. It is assumed that there is only one argument per option.

Returns:
an array of Strings that are the options that have arguments.

fail

protected static void fail(java.lang.String reason)
fail is a method for quitting unexpectedly, and reporting a reason to the user.

Parameters:
reason - - the reason to give to the user.

fail

protected static void fail(java.lang.String reason,
                           java.lang.Exception ex)
fail is a method for quitting unexpectedly, and reporting a reason to the user. this fail accepts an exception as a reason for failure, and dispalys that fact to the user.

Parameters:
reason - - the reason to give to the user.
ex - - the exception that caused the failure.

getIn

protected static java.io.File getIn(java.lang.String pathIn)
getIn returns a File for the input file chosen by the user. the program will exit if the path is incorrect, or the file is not readable.

Parameters:
pathIn - - the path to the real file.
Returns:
a File for the input.

getModel

protected static java.lang.String getModel(java.io.File fIn)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
getModel returns a string for the model's name, within a BBF document. if there are multiple models, the user is prompted to choose one or exit.

Parameters:
fIn - - the input file to scour for models.
Returns:
the name of the model found or chosen
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when the XDocumenter has a problem getting model names.
See Also:
XDocumenter.getMainModelNames(java.io.File)

getOut

protected static java.io.File getOut(java.lang.String pathOut)
                              throws java.io.IOException
getOut returns a File for the output file chosen by the user. an existent file at given path will get deleted in the process.

Parameters:
pathOut - - the path for the output file, as provided by the user.
Returns:
a File for putting the output into.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - when the file management experiences an issue.

makeOptMap

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> makeOptMap(java.lang.String[] opts)
                                                                throws java.lang.Exception
makeOptMap parses a String array into a HashMap. If an option requires an argument, the argument is the value to a key with that option. if the option does not require an argument, the key gets put on the map, with "true" as it's value. these "true" values are not currently in use. Options MUST start with a '-' character. Consequentially, arguments to options MUST NEVER start with a '-' character.

Parameters:
opts - - an arary of strings that represents the user's options.
Returns:
a HashMap of the user's selections.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when an error in user input is found.

needsArgument

protected boolean needsArgument(java.lang.String opt)
needsArgument checks if an option string represents a user option that requires an argument to be used correctly.

Parameters:
opt - - the string of the user option.
Returns:
true if the option is in the list of options that requires an argument, false otherwise.
